intro: Descurainia pinnata var. brachycarpon, commonly known as narrowleaf tansy, is a flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes. The leaves are alternate, pinnately divided, and often have a slightly hairy texture. This variety is native to North America and thrives in dry, sandy soils. It is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and open fields.
